channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Prophetic Tommy Lascelles
item.description: His 20th-century observations about the character of King Edward VIII are newly relevant in the Washington, D.C., of the 21st.

item.title: JPMorgan renames DEI program ‘DOI’ following political backlash
item.description: JPMorgan Chase is changing the name of its diversity, equity, and inclusion program at a time when DEI has been attacked by President Trump’s administ...

item.title: Rogue Judges Are Turning Judicial Review Into Judicial Rule
item.description: Boasberg’s ruling is just the latest example of a judge substituting his own political preferences for executive decision-making.

item.title: DOGE Madness: ‘Sweet 16’ bracket set up as craziest federal waste competes for championship

item.title: Trump crackdown on transgender athletes in girls' sports gets GOP backup in House bill
item.description: A new House GOP bill seeks to codify President Donald Trump's executive order on transgender athletes.

item.title: Sea of lawsuits stir debate about formula for premature babies
item.description: Parents of premature babies are contending with head-spinning legal drama over specialized formulas that U.S. agencies have endorsed as standard optio...

item.title: Campaign to ‘Decolonize’ Shakespeare’s Hometown Exposes DEI’s Double Standards
item.description: The relentless character assassination of the West continues apace.

item.title: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett was reportedly paid $2 million for her new book coming this year, including a $425,000 advance
item.description: Barrett, 53, is the youngest member of the Supreme Court.

item.title: Judge Overreaches Amid Latest Lawfare Against Trump
item.description: Judge James Boasberg hastily took command and control over the latest iteration of lawfare. His orders and reactions are laden with error.

item.title: The Week: Trump Takes On the Courts
item.description: Plus: Internet sleuths devour the JFK files.

item.title: Illinois Bill Would Let Failing School System Send Homeschooling Parents To Jail
item.description: A new bill requires parents to report themselves to their local school district, and parents who do not will be considered truant.

item.title: Schizo De Niro
item.description: The acting icon flaunts his own sickness in The Alto Knights .

item.title: DOGE’s plans for social security are back door way to cut payments, experts and former official warn: ‘This is the most serious threat I’ve ever seen to it’
item.description: Elon Musk's government efficiency team, DOGE, is taking aim at Social Security, claiming fraud while pushing controversial changes.

item.title: Musk tells Tesla employees hang on to stock after 50% plunge
item.description: Elon Musk sought to reassure Tesla employees after the carmaker’s shares plunged more than 50% in just three months.

item.description: The report authors suggest several strategies, including urging legislators to remove marriage penalties and legal frameworks that increase the tax bu...

item.title: Top candidates are avoiding the CEO role. Here’s how to make the gig worth taking
item.description: The chief executive role has lost its luster despite hefty compensation packages.

item.title: Trump signs executive order aims to streamline federal procurement under GSA
item.description: President Trump has signed an executive order that centralizes federal government procurement under the General Services Administration.

item.title: Senator Sanders targets Trump, Musk and Democrats in wide-ranging interview ahead of rally with AOC
item.description: In a Fox News Digital interview, Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont takes aim at Donald Trump, Elon Musk, Republicans, and Democrats.

item.title: California’s Massive Medicaid Shortfall Would Disappear If It Quit Paying $8B For Illegals’ Health Care

item.title: Book Review: Buffett’s Early Investments
item.description: This book digs into Buffett’s pre-Berkshire investments. The result is a fresh look into the origins of his investment approach.

item.title: The Alternative View: 401(k) Plans Are Better off Without Private Investments
item.description: The debate over the inclusion of private investments in 401(k) plans is a hot topic. Are DC plans better off without them?

item.description: Financial success depends on disciplined saving and investing, not fancy investment products and high returns.

item.title: Decades in a Week: Germany’s Fiscal Breakthrough and Its Global Impact
item.description: Does Germany's massive fiscal package mark the beginning of a lasting regime change or just another chapter in market volatility?
